item.description: If you are landing on this page you probably already know what SSH is and how to use it through CLI. If not, take a quick look here. In general SSH is the most common tool people use to connect to remote systems and servers. Usually, in the beginning, people start with simple ssh <user>@<host> CLI usage. With time, using more and more advanced options, the commands become lengthy and clumsy resulting in a mess that are hard or impossible to remember.
